title: Goat Bubbles 2013 Sierra Madre Vineyard Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A light touch of sweetness combines with ripe apple and pear flavors to make this full-bodied wine from Schramsberg taste rich and mouth filling. Layers of fruit and light spices spread across the palate and linger on the finish.
title: Mirabelle NV Mirabelle Brut Sparkling (California)

description: By sourcing French Colombard and force carbonating like beer, David Potter made this fun and tasty wine as an antidote to the high prices that sparkling wine traditionally require. Aromas of apple cider, crisp Granny Smith apples, key lime, yellow melon and chalk lead into a palate laced with fatter bubbles and flavors of more apple and pear.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2016 Mubbly Sparkling (California)

description: Another fine brut from Korbel, dry, yeasty and citrusy, just like a good bubbly should be. It's a little rough and scoury in the bubbles, but at this price, a good deal.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Bouvet Ladubay's rosé is a soft in style with a light fruit flavor dominated by fresh raspberries. There's also a touch of tannin in the texture, resulting in a sparkling wine that is more for food than an aperitif.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rosé Excellence Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: A blend of 70% Pinot Nero and 30% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of toast, roasted nuts, mature apple and pear. The palate offers rich apricot, citrus, bread crust and vanilla alongside a fine, persistent perlage.
title: Maso Martis 2007 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

description: Made with no dosage, this is a blend of 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Nero. Ripe apple, toasted walnut, lemon zest and bread dough flavors are backed up by crisp acidity. The refined perlage adds softness and elegance.
title: Maso Martis 2009 Dosaggiozero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

description: Pretty peach in color, this 50-50 sparkling blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, with a small percentage of the Pinot added to the blend before secondary fermentation, is a light, high-toned, flinty bubbly rich in strawberry aromas and a savory, herbal streak.
title: Mumm Napa 2008 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Pear, citrus and hazelnut aromas lead the nose on this sparkling wine made with no added dosage. The palate reveals juicy yellow apple, lime and roasted nut alongside soft acidity and a refined, persistent mousse. It finishes tangy and dry.
title: Ricci Curbastro 2007 Gualberto Dosaggio Zero Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: While this is a nonvintage wine, it is still very young and will benefit from time in bottle. That will allow the rich apple and crisp lemon flavors to round out, calming the intense acidity. The potential of this rich wine is considerable.
title: Domaine Charles Baur NV Emotion Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Small in production and clearly defined from Carneros, this Blanc de Noirs blends 92% Pinot Noir with 8% Chardonnay to great effect. Pretty in peach color, the intense flavors are a combination of fresh-cut herb and strawberry kirsch.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This budget-priced rosé sparkler is earthy and mushroomy, with modest berry flavors, a slightly creamy texture and citrus zest on the finish.
title: Yellow Tail 2015 Pink Bubbles Sparkling (South Australia)

description: This blend of Chenin Blanc and Cabernet Franc is the most successful of the Baumard sparkling wines. It is fruity, very fresh and crisp while also having the potential for some bottle aging. Acidity and a tangy aftertaste contribute to its lively freshness.
title: Domaine des Baumard NV Carte Turquoise Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: Apple fruitiness dominates this fresh sparkling wine. A light mousse plays on the crisp texture, giving a lively, fresh final acidity. It's a great apéritif style.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel NV Brut Tradition Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Whiffs of honey and caramel entice on this elegant late-disgorged sparkler. A blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it's delicately pétillant, filling the palate with soft, supple mousse and whispers of biscuit, citrus rind and berry.
title: Glenora 2006 Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: What an aromatic tease: there is elderflower, tart passion fruit and lots of fruity exuberance. The interplay between lip-smacking tartness and almost frivolous fruit makes for liveliness, excitement and joy. Serve this when you want your guests to sparkle as much as the wine. Autolytic flavors are subtle but provide a creamy finish.
title: Camel Valley 2012 Brut Sparkling (England)

description: Two-thirds Pinot Noir and one-third Chardonnay, this aged a decade in bottle on the yeast, before being disgorged in August 2015. Amazingly fresh, it bursts with subtle, well-integrated flavors of citrus rind, peach, almond and pastry. The length and imposing structure suggest it can age for another decade. Drink now through 2025.
title: Argyle 2005 Extended Tirage Brut Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: The petillance is faint on this Cava. Aromas of sweat and bread introduce flavors of pink grapefruit and tart apple. An abrasive mouthfeel delivers generic citrus flavors.
title: Jaume Serra NV Cristalino Extra-Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: Floral notes play about the tart berry fruit of this harmonious and generously fruited fizz. The palate is exuberant with lively red-berry fruit while creamy notes of biscuit and oatmeal provide a wonderful balance. This is fresh and frothy, creamy and utterly irresistible. The lasting finish is wonderfully dry.
title: Ridgeview Estate 2014 Fitzrovia Rosé Sparkling (England)

description: Melon aromas are a touch mealy and suggest cantaloupe that's past its peak. A foamy palate is coarse, while tastes of burnt orange and red plum. On the finish, this dissipates quickly.
title: Vicente Gandia NV El Miracle Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: Exuberant green apple and quince aromas meet a savory almond-croissant tone on the nose of this 100% Chardonnay sparkler. Time in French oak and extended aging on the lees have rounded and broadened the mouthfeel, offering a rich palate accented by lemon rind and candied nuts. Vibrant acidity and finely-beaded bubbles keep things light and entertaining.
title: Trump 2008 SP Reserve Brut Sparkling (Monticello)

description: Crisp clean white-fruit aromas come with a hint of clover. This is mellow and mature on the palate, with nothing aggressive or edgy. Dry, peppery, yeasty flavors show little overt fruit, while this offers a hint of green melon on a dry complex finish.
title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2008 Magnum Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: The orange, vanilla and cream flavors are tasty, but the texture is scoury and harsh in the mouth, with rough bubbles that cut with acidity.
title: Pope Valley Winery 2010 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This opens with vanilla and sweet, powdery aromas. In the mouth, it's bubbly and foamy, with a mix of pickled citrus and dry apple flavors. The finish is crisp and dry like a soda cracker.
title: Tarantas 2011 Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Creamy, lush and somewhat robust, this dry sparkler offers a thick mousse and touch of richness in its mix of nutty bread dough, green apple, pear and lime.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Very fruity and fresh in aroma, this elegant wine has light, crisp apple and lemon flavors, fresh-baked bread accents and lively acidity. A layered texture seems to blend in accents of almond and vanilla, increasing complexity with each sip. It's one of California's blue-chip bubblies.
title: Roederer Estate 2007 Brut L'Ermitage Estate Bottled Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: The opulence of this sparkling wine has to be tasted to be believed. It's far softer and silkier than the winery's companion new release, the 2005 J. Schram, but then the blend is the complete opposite. This one's mainly Pinot Noir, with the balance from Chardonnay. The Pinot Noir brings a warm, raspberry- and cherry-sauce richness to Chardonnay's limes and pears, while an extraordinarily delicious toastiness pervades the whole, as if it had been gently smoked. So enticing now, it's hard to keep from drinking the whole bottle, and you certainly can, but this is a wine that will age for 10–15 years.
title: Schramsberg 2004 Reserve Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: An unusual blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Pinot Grigio and Pinot Meunier, this bubbly is, in a word, delicious. It's ripe with oranges, pineapples, honey and vanilla, with crisp acidity and a Champagne-like sourdough leesiness.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Fresh, clean apple and white-peach aromas are good but not overly expressive or complex. This feels fresh and lifted, with minerally, stony flavors of apple and lime. A clean, pointed finish feels nice and tastes like lettuce and bitter greens.
title: Segura Viudas NV Reserva Heredad Sparkling (Cava)

description: Fairly deep in color for a sparkling rosé, Sparr's Brut Rosé offers bold, berry-like aromas with hints of spring flowers and a plump, slightly corpulent feel in the mouth. The flavors are a bit rustic, with hints of underbrush and scorched earth.
title: Pierre Sparr NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Alsace)

description: Red in color, and definitely smelling and tasting like Malbec. And while you want to like it more, there are some glaring flaws here, namely a weak bead that turns it flat. Furthermore, there's rhubarby sourness at the core. Has its moments but needs more work.
title: Reginato 2007 Celestina Rosé of Malbec Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: A little sweet and one-dimensional, with candied flavors of raspberries and limes.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rose Sparkling (California)

description: A laser-focused nose of lime zest, limestone and a hint of orange blossom characterize this very refreshing sparkler. The bubbles dance across the tongue with lean, not lush flavors of orange peel and squeezed citrus.
title: Laetitia 2011 Brut de Blancs Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: An unusual blend of 48% Chardonnay, 43% Pinot Noir, 6% Pinot Gris and 3% Pinot Meunier, this is pale sunflower-yellow, with a thick mousse and well-developed layers of orange blossom, lemon and pear.
title: Mumm Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Fragrances recall acacia, white spring flowers, honey, bread dough and beeswax. The concentrated palate delivers mature yellow apple, toasted walnut, clove, vanilla and pie crust alongside vivacious, persistent effervescence.
title: Bellavista 2007 Pas Operé Extra Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Yeasty and woody after lengthy time in the bottle, this is a complex cuvée that's dry and savory more than sweet. Secondary flavors of apple and pear are crisp and developed.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2006 Royal Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A fruit-driven style of sparkling wine, with apple and citrus notes only slightly touched by yeastiness. It's a bit coarse in texture, but soft and cuddly on the finish, making it easy to back for another sip.
title: Jip Jip Rocks NV Sparkling Cuvée Sparkling (Padthaway)

description: With a pale copper color, this is a full-bodied sparkler whose orange, raspberry and vanilla flavors offer plenty of satisfaction. It's a little sweet, but fine acidity and a scour of bubbles provide clean balance.
title: Korbel NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: This sparkling wine boasts a dark pink color and intensely fragrant tones of raspberry, cranberry, fresh flowers, cut grass and dandelions. It is executed in a light, easy style and makes for a fun afternoon-with-friends sipping wine.
title: Colutta NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Friuli)

description: This amber-colored Riserva offers slightly oxidized flavors of caramel, butterscotch and yellow rose. There are Sherry notes in there too, but not enough of them to disregard the wine. It shows good length and persistency.
title: Contratto 1999 Riserva Giuseppe Contratto Sparkling (Piedmont)

description: Peach-pink in color, this vibrant rosé sparkler offers unique aromas of cut grass, dried flowers and forest berries. It's an easy-going wine that would pair well with appetizers thanks to its crisp, fresh feel.
title: Costaripa NV Brut Rosé  (Lugana)

description: An opulent style from one of Tasmania's most well known sparkling producers, this bubbly starts on enticing aromas of buttered toast, lemon curd, and copper penny. The palate offers more richness and a mouthfilling mousse, along with an intriguing herbaceousness on the finish.
title: Jansz NV Premium Cuvée Sparkling (Tasmania)

description: The attractive new label design introduces this clean, simple, pleasant rosé, a blend of Pinot Noir and 7% Pinot Meunier. Quite foamy, it subsides into a pale pink wine with hints of strawberry fruit.
title: Michelle NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: From entirely estate-grown Pinot Noir (70%) and Chardonnay (30%), this dry sparkling is vivacious and fun, crisp in apple, pear and raspberry. Lively, lemony acidity lifts the palate. Complementing the freshness is the rounded plushness of ripe fruit and an earthy accent.
title: Balletto 2012 Brut Rosé Méthode Traditionelle Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A méthode Champenoise blend of 92% Pinot Noir and 8% Chardonnay, this dry, crisp sparkler shows a finesse of texture wrapped in green apple, preserved lemon and vanilla. It's light and bright.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Dusty spiced-apple aromas set up a stony, drawn-in palate with a mix of tart tangerine and pickled flavors. On the finish, this is fresh, almost sour in flavor, and light in weight.
title: Alta Alella 2014 Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Grassy aromas of clover and mustard are a warning that this wine isn't hitting the high notes. Foamy and coarse on the palate, this tastes like applesauce, while woodspice and cinnamon notes come up on the finish.
title: New Age NV Brut Sparkling

description: Made to benefit the exploratory organization, this high-toned stunner exudes flavors of Gravenstein apple followed by a slight richness of marzipan. Moderate acidity and weight makes it a fine companion for the table, finishing with a sense of welcome fullness.
designation: National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs
title: Iron Horse 2013 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This blends Pinot Noir and Chardonnay into a sparkling experience that's dry and floral, with yeasty, toasty overtones that give it a deep sense of richness. Along with developed flavors of plum, cherry and apple, it lingers in nutmeg.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Made from 80% Pinot Noir and 20% Chardonnay, this dances in cherry and orange brightness within a construct of white peach. The pretty-in-pink color gives way to buzzing acidity and freshness before a medium-strength creaminess flows through on the finish.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Crisp peach and red-fruit flavors combine with vibrant acidity and energizing, fine bubbles to create a balanced and rich sparkling wine. A spicy, crisp fruit character lingers long on the finish.
title: Roederer Estate NV Estate Bottled Brut Rosé Sparkling (Anderson Valley)

description: This smells yeasty and toasty/smoky, with mild white-fruit scents. For the most part, the palate feels clean and fresh, while papaya, white peach and melon flavors finish with sweetness.
title: Freixenet NV Carta Nevada Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Standard apple aromas come with hints of sulfur. The palate on this off-dry Cava is flat and easy, while flavors of nectarine and passion fruit finish grassy but also a bit citrusy.
title: Freixenet NV Cordon Negro Extra Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: This rosé opens with a floral and fruity fragrance of orange blossom and strawberry. The palate delivers white cherry, creamy berry, Alpine herb, clove and cinnamon notes. The wine is fresh and elegantly sparkling.
title: Cola NV Athena Rosé Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This elegant sparkling wine has a subdued fragrance that reveals delicate floral and nut aromas. The palate is more expressive, offering citrus, tropical fruit and roasted almond flavors. The pleasant foamy texture is accompanied by lively acidity.
title: Antica Fratta NV Brut Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This wine is a light gold color, with appetizing pear and crisp apple aromas. Firm acidity, a lively texture and absolutely fresh flavors make it a pleasure to drink.
designation: Cuvée Brut Made With Organically Grown Grapes
title: McFadden NV Cuvée Brut Made With Organically Grown Grapes Sparkling (Potter Valley)

description: Pale salmon color with some copper hints. Somewhat muted nose with  subtle aromas of ripe red-berry fruit. Crisp with more lift on the palate, vigorous mousse and lively flavors of redcurrant, wild strawberry and cherry. Medium-bodied with some creaminess to the texture that persists on the finish. Well-made but not very complex.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Alsace)

description: Pale color with fairly vigorous bubbles. Moderate aromas intensity showing mainly a medley of fresh apple aromas. Creamy mousse on the palate, slightly soft with some persistence. Similar orchard flavors prevail in the mouth Quite crisp, light to medium-bodied with a smooth finish. Simple and easy-drinking.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Cremant Brut Sparkling (Alsace)

description: A mix of smoke and toast blends with fresh, crisp citrus aromas on the nose. That's followed by a foamy, reactive palate with flavors of pink grapefruit, orange, pepper and caramel. This remains foamy on the finish, which is peppery and slightly bitter in flavor.
title: Sumarroca NV Yá Cuvée 23 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: This lovely sparkling wine is made with no dosage or added sugar. It offers scents of warm, just baked bread, citrus and roasted almond. The palate offers peach, apple, citrus and a hint of walnut along with crisp, clean acidity. It's smooth, with fine bubbles and a creamy texture.
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2009 Pas Dosé Vintage Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This wine is soft and creamy, although it does seem to miss out on fruit and freshness. It is smooth and ripe, with an aftertaste that is lightly off dry.
title: Monmousseau NV Brut Etoile Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This off-dry wine offers ripe strawberry flavors and refreshing acidity. It's a summer-evening drink, although it would do just as well round the fire
title: Marquis de la Tour NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This uncomplicated sparkling wine is fresh and fruity, with a touch of yeastiness. It's light, bright and dry yet also soft and ready to drink.
title: Marcel Martin NV Louise d'Estrée Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: A mix of smoke and toast blends with fresh, crisp citrus aromas on the nose. That's followed by a foamy, reactive palate with flavors of pink grapefruit, orange, pepper and caramel. This remains foamy on the finish, which is peppery and slightly bitter in flavor.
title: Sumarroca NV Yá Cuvée 23 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: The film director's sparkling ode to his director daughter delivers aromas of apple blossoms, pear cider and chalk. An apparent sweetness on the palate is cut with a pithy grip, the apple-juice base leveled with ample lime elements.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Sofia Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Monterey County)

description: A bit rough on the palate, this is dryish and rich, with flavors of citrus, sourdough bread and spice that are wrapped into the creamy texture.
title: McIntyre Vineyards NV L'Homme Qui Ris Sparkling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made in a frankly sweet style, this blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has jellied flavors of raspberries, cherries and toast. It's a little rough in texture.
title: Schramsberg NV Mirabelle Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: The vintage was a very ripe one, and the heat shows. It's very forward, almost jammy, in sweet strawberry and peach flavors. This robs the wine of some elegance and finesse, but it's still an attractive sipper.
title: Domaine Carneros 2004 Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Linear and fresh, this delivers aromas and flavors of ripe pear, golden apple, tangerine and aromatic herb. Bright acidity offsets the creamy flavors while an elegant mousse provides the backdrop.
title: Maso Martis 2009 Brut Metodo Classico Riserva Sparkling (Trento)

description: Slightly yeasty notes of brioche and sugar cookie entice on the nose of this full-bodied lavishly foamy sparkling. It's weighty and expansive on the palate but balanced by high-toned acidity and fresh apple and pear flavors.
title: Damiani 2011 Méthode Champenoise Brut Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: Dusty notes of citrus fruits are mild but friendly. This Cava is zesty, fresh and simple as a whole, with lime, clover and grassy flavors. Freshness is the overriding theme, while the finish tastes of apple and lime.
title: 1+1=3 NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: A complex blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Weissburgunder, this is a rich, spicy wine, dry in style and with some tannins. It has weight and density, but doesn't lose its creamy, fresh texture and acidity. It should age another year in bottle to get the best out of this serious wine.
title: Steininger 2010 Burgunder Sekt Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

description: Chalky minerality meshes with soft, clean and crisp pink grapefruit flesh and blossom on the nose of this wine by Norm Yost, one of the first to make sparklers annually in Santa Barbara. More grapefruit flavors consume the palate alongside cut pears, sliced apples and wet cement, offering a texture that's both crisp and rich.
title: Goat Bubbles 2013 Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Santa Barbara County)

description: Yeasty aromas lead to a wine that is bright with crisp apples and soft lemon-juice flavors. There is a hint of white bread roll, which rounds it out.
title: Grandial NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Best on the nose, where apple and lemony aromas are true. In the mouth, it's foamy and crude, with crushing citrus and cidery flavors. Rough, bubbly and massive; tough stuff to swallow.
title: Tacama 2010 Brut Sparkling (Ica)

description: An awesome rosé, just a tremendous feat. Made from 11 vineyards in 4 counties, it shows a masterful art of the blend. Insanely rich in toasted bread and lees, showing the influence of six years in the bottle. A tremendous core of strawberries, raspberries, orange zest, roasted macadamia, roasted coconut, pear liqueur and honey lasts into the finish. Despite the richness, the wine is dry. So lovely now you can hardly keep your hands off, but it should age gracefully for the next 10–15 years.
title: Schramsberg 2004 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)

description: This is easy to like for its clean, brisk mouthfeel, creaminess and slightly sweet flavors of lime and strawberry. Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it shows real finesse.
title: V. Sattui 2009 Prestige Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Made from Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, this is one of the winery's best Pompadours of the last four years. It's rich and delicious, with yeasty flavors of raspberries, strawberries, vanilla, toast and honey. It's beautiful to drink now with pâté, scrambled eggs and smoked salmon.
title: Domaine Carneros NV Cuvée de la Pompadour Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: With abundant floral and stone-fruit notes on the nose and palate, this New York sparkler is on the sweet side of brut. Brisk in acidity and surprisingly pétillant, this $9 sparkler is an irresistible weeknight bubbly.
designation: Gabrielle Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling Wine
title: Ambition NV Gabrielle Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling Wine Sparkling (New York)

description: Made entirely from Chardonnay, it shows real delicacy and richness, with a mousse as smooth as fine satin. Flavorwise, it's enormously rich, suggesting oranges, limes, honey, vanilla, toast and the sweet, yeasty doughiness of a brioche pastry. Really gorgeous, a worthy followup to the fabulous 2005 La Rêve.
title: Domaine Carneros 2006 Le Rêve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is an easy, tasty bubbly, with raspberry, orange and vanilla flavors. Blended from French Columbard, Chardonnay, Sangiovese and Gamay, it's crisp in acidity, with a sweet finish.
designation: Brut Made with Organically Grown Grapes
title: Korbel 2011 Brut Made with Organically Grown Grapes Sparkling (California)

description: This is a refreshing picnic wine with light acidity, touches of pears and some sweetness. Its low alcohol makes it great for summer sunshine.
title: Louis Perdrier NV Brut Excellence Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Pure apple fruit emerges above the wonderfully biscuity autolysis notes and a touch of oak lends generosity and body, but nothing ever subdues the genuine fruit here, which expresses itself as the poised scent of ripe yellow and red apples. The acidity is exemplary, tight and focused, while the bready yeast notes add extra dimensions of body and texture. The length and persistence are a marvel. A total class act that is delicious now and will become honeyed with age.
title: Arndorfer 2010 Die Leidenschaft...prickelnd Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

description: This blends Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris and Pinot Meunier, with a slightly sweet dosage providing rich creaminess. Soft, moderate acidity leans against a taste of vanilla cream, ripe peach and honey.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Cuvée M Sparkling (Napa County)

description: This seemingly sweet wine shows lots of ripe, rich raspberries and vanilla, with a nice yeasty doughiness. Yet there's good acidity, and the finish is very clean.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: White flower and pink bubblegum notes lend a slightly confected tone to this semisweet Hungarian sparkling wine, but it's an undeniably drinkable, peach-flavored sip, with sharp effervescence and a tasty sugar-cookie finish.
title: Törley NV Fortuna Doux Sparkling (Hungary)

description: This is made in a fruity style, with attractive red-fruit flavors. It is dry and laced with acidity. It has richness, a full body and refreshing final acidity.
title: Jaffelin NV Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A bit rough and scouring in texture, this tastes too sweet. Its orange and strawberry notes have a sugary edge. It's an easy bubbly to drink at parties.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: This sparkling Pinot Noir is a surprisingly sophisticated find for its reasonable price tag. It's perfumed and fresh, offering delicate cherry blossom and red apple notes, intensified by a dusty mineral complexity. Zesty acidity and fine, persistent bubbles linger through a long, floral finish. Drink now through 2021.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2014 Rüdesheim Pinot Sekt Brut Sparkling (Rheingau)

description: A little cidery and funky smelling at first, but it settles to show stalky notes, scallion, tarragon and citrus flavors. Layered in feel but a bit green tasting throughout.
title: Jaume Serra NV Cristalino Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Floral strawberry notes subtly perfume the nose on this taut and creamily fizzy sparkling brut. The slender, light-footed palate is enriched with some of that broader Pinot-structure and slips down rather easily. This makes for a classy, grown-up apéritif—its dryness lets the fruit and structure speak, offering an echo of beautiful floral overtones.
title: Malat 2011 Brut Reserve Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

description: Punchy yet secure aromas of apple, pear, grass and green herbs are expansive. A forward, layered, sensuous palate delivers yeasty, toasty apple and pear flavors. On the finish, softness, depth and richness share space alongside acidity and length. Drink through 2019.
title: Llopart 2009 Leopardi Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Full-bodied and a little forwardly sweet, this deeply colored blush bubbly has flavors of raspberries and cherries, accented with smoky yeast, vanilla cookie and peppery spice. Drink now through 2010.
title: Laetitia 2005 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This medium-bodied bargain-priced sparkler is maybe just a touch on the heavy side, but it should satisfy most party crowds. Hints of toast accent pineapple and tropical fruit notes, finishing soft and short. Worth trying in Mimosas or Bellinis.
title: Beelgara NV The Vines Brut Cuvée Sparkling (South Eastern Australia)

description: A familiar Cava aroma of lime sets up a foamy, active palate. Lime, mango and Thompson Seedless flavors finish quick yet clean.
title: Eximius NV Semi-Dry Sparkling (Cava)

description: Pinkish-orange in color, this is made from 84% Pinot Noir and 16% Pinot Meunier and offers a wealth of ripe cherry and strawberry. Dry, it has a taste of sour orange and is fairly simple, without much in the way of a finish. The acidity is quite moderate.
title: Four Sisters Ranch NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: The nose is rather closed but the palate displays crisp, refreshing and mellow notes of apple. All the flavors are restrained but elegant while the mousse underlines all this with soft, finely-tuned creaminess. All this results in a dry refreshing understatement.
title: Wunsch & Mann NV Cuvée Traditionelle Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Red berry, crushed stone and herbs aromas open. The vibrant, polished palate delivers tart cherry, strawberry, tangerine and a hint of pastry alongside zesty acidity and small, persistent bubbles.
title: Cascina Chicco 2012 Cuvée Zero Rosé Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

description: Generous and inviting notes of peach and yellow plum make for an exuberant, almost festive, nose. The palate is equally rich with generous stone fruit: peach, plum and mirabelle plum. A spike of lemony freshness provides a balance on the frothily fresh palate. Full marks for fruit and joy.
title: Cave de Ribeauvillé NV Giersberger Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This is not a cookie-cutter Cava. It opens with apple juice aromas along with yeast and white-bread scents. In the mouth, this feels a bit bready and soft. Yeasty flavors of papaya, green banana and melon see a white-bread note return on the finish. This is 100% Xarello (Pansa Blanca).
title: Alta Alella 2015 Privat Bruant Organic Sparkling (Cava)

description: Dusty white-fruit aromas are grassy and smell of vitamins. This is plump on the palate, with little cut or edge. Generic apple and melon flavors are cloying on the finish.
title: Conde de Subirats NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Unfocused, somewhat compromised aromas of green banana and papaya are a bit soapy. This is acceptable but coarse in feel. Peppery green-fruit flavors echo in milder fashion on the finish.
title: Chatel NV Brut Selección Sparkling (Cava)

description: Iodine and briny citrus aromas are hardly the red carpet entry you might hope for. In the mouth, this is cushioned, with briny flavors of apple and nectarine that finish bitter. This will probably go down best with a splash of orange or peach juice. On it's own it struggles.
title: Berberana NV Gran Tradición Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: This lovely Mendocino sparkler, crafted from two-thirds Chardonnay and one-third Pinot Noir, has lilting apple and honey aromas buoyed by a thick head of mousse. There is a pleasing follow-through from aroma to flavor and a core of ripe apple. Dry, soft with a long finish, this is a hard-to-resist food-friendly wine ready to pair widely.
title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Sparkling (Mendocino County)

description: A rich, bready nose smells of fresh-baked croissants. Flavors of tropical fruit and peach are slightly bitter and carry a saline note, while the finish ends taut and dry. Drink through 2020.
designation: Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature
title: Vins El Cep 2012 Cla Ror Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: The nectarine and mild vanilla aromas are subdued yet solid. On the palate, it's all about stone fruit flavors, such as peach and nectarine, with apple and cider notes on the balanced and healthy finish.
title: Mont Marçal 2008 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: Combining 76% Pinot Noir and 24% Chardonnay, this wine has a depth of richness and focused, supportive acidity that work well to complement each other. Stone fruit, vanilla biscuit, cherry kirsch and green apple are all within the spectrum of flavors here, finishing with grace and a hint of spice.
title: Iron Horse 2012 Classic Vintage Brut Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Beautiful in peach color, this blends 73% Chardonnay and 27% Pinot Noir. Dry and crisp, it tangles together vibrant flavors of grapefruit, tangerine and cherry, as aromas of rose petal whisper by. A stony mineral component adds complexity and invitation to the texture.
title: Schramsberg 2013 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This attractively fruity offering features floral, fruity flavors that are cut by crisp acidity. It is a bright, light and fruity sparkler, with just a touch of sweetness.
title: Marquis de Perlade NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: This bubbly is on the sweet side. It has sugary pineapple and orange flavors. A little scoury in texture, it's an easy sparkling wine to drink with sweet foods, like wedding cake.
title: Korbel NV Sweet Cuvée Sparkling (California)

description: Crisp, apple-flavored and touched by citrus, this is light and toasty. The finish is dry, fruity and fresh. Ready to drink.
designation: Grande Cuvée Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Le Grand Courtage NV Grande Cuvée Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Persistent bubbles deliver lively aromas of kumquat, yeast, sharp lemon and wet slate on the tight, never opulent nose of this bottling. The palate's creamy bubbles are very pleasant in texture, delivering sharp, acid-driven flavors of citrus and a touch of brioche.
title: Presqu'ile 2012 Rosé Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Soft, almost candied strawberry flavors dominate the nose and just off-dry palate. Fruit is in the foreground and plays beautifully against the light, softly bubbly backdrop of the palate. This is a summery apéritif or the style of wine to accompany berries and berry-based desserts.
title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei NV Rosé Secco Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)

description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir grapes, this marks the first offering of this rosé from this ranch in the heart of Carneros. Dry and simple in approach, it delivers a crispness of lemon, lime and strawberry, becoming rich on the palate as it lingers.
title: Mumm Napa 2011 Devaux Ranch Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Raspberry and lettuce aromas are fresh but a touch grassy. This rosé has a fresh, clean feel and dry flavors of citrus fruits and nectarine. Dryness is a repeated theme on the finish, which is long, pure and focused.
title: Alta Alella 2013 Privat Reserva Brut Nature Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: An opening salvo of honey and white fruits is solid as can be. The palate rolls out dry, angular citrus, pineapple and apple flavors in front of a finish that's naturally fresh and nutty. A bubbly with no muss, fuss or confusion. Best if you like ‘em dry.
designation: Capdevila Pujol Reserva Especial Brut Natural
title: Cava Blancher NV Capdevila Pujol Reserva Especial Brut Natural Sparkling (Cava)

description: This is easy to like for its clean, brisk mouthfeel, creaminess and slightly sweet flavors of lime and strawberry. Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it shows real finesse.
title: V. Sattui 2009 Prestige Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: A little sweet on the nose, with powdered sugar, vanilla and white fruit aromas. Feels foamy but just fresh enough, with apple, melon and controlled stalky flavors. Finishes with dry apple notes. Good for Argentine sparkling; 70% Chardonnay and 30% Chenin Blanc.
title: Hom NV Extra Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: A blend of Cabernet Franc and Pinot Noir, this pale pink rosé has really fresh acidity and crisp apple fruits. There are just hints of red-berry fruits and a touch of tannin that gives the wine an edge of dryness. The aftertaste, with the creamy mousse, is fresh and lively.
title: Monmousseau NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: The wine is soft, round and full in the mouth, with balance between fresh citrus and ripe melon and pear fruits. The acidity gives a great lift, adding to the steely texture and final burst of fruit.
title: Dopff & Irion NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A first-ever sparkling wine from this popular producer, it's a yeasty, toasty, rather thick 50-50 mix of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. The grapes were fermented dry down to barely 11% alcohol, yet there's a heaviness to the palate that fights against the elegance characteristic of most sparkling wines. Pineapple and grapefruit are the dominant fruit flavors. Young and acidic, this will cellar well for many years.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Grower Series Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: This new sparkler from Apaltagua is yeasty on the nose, with ham, salami and wheat notes. The palate isn't shy, as full-force malic acid brings more kick than grace. Flavors of cider and butterscotch finish short but clean.
title: Apaltagua NV Costero Extra Brut Sparkling (San Antonio)

description: Grassy citrus aromas rest comfortably on a mild, nonaggressive bouquet. A citrusy mouthfeel isn't overly bubbly, while pithy lime and tangerine flavors finish mild, with tangy acidity and a cleansing quality.
title: Conde de Caralt NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: A rich, fruity bubbly for drinking now. It's a little coarse and scoury, but delicious, with candied lime, strawberry and vanilla flavors.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Creamy and delicious, this offers aromas that recall ripe orchard fruit, bread crust and citrus. The elegant palate doles out mature yellow apple, tangerine zest, pastry and hazelnut, all lifted by a silky perlage that leaves you wanting more.
title: Ca' del Bosco 2011 Vintage Collection Brut Metodo Classico Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: A blend of Sémillon and Cabernet Franc, this is a smooth, soft wine. It has soft fruitiness, some fresh acidity and a light but clean aftertaste.
title: Jaillance NV Brut  (Crémant de Bordeaux)

description: Pale yellow-pink in color, this sparkler shows watermelon rind and flesh, red pear skins, orange zest and plush nectarine on the very accessible nose, which will please veterans and neophytes alike. The palate combines a baking soda character with stone fruit and ripe Asian pear slices.
title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Brut Rosé Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This off-dry sparkling is made from 78% Flora, 13% Pinot Noir and 9% Chardonnay. It works in its inviting, rich array of stone-fruit and tropical accents, met by a floral underbelly of inviting aroma. Creamy, voluptuous and well-made, it'll pair well with spicy dishes and is perfectly refreshing and delightful on its own.
title: Schramsberg 2013 Crémant Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: An easy-drinking pink wine, this has sweet flavors of raspberry and cherry soda, honey and vanilla.
title: Moreno BHLV NV Rosé Sparkling (California)

description: Based in the Jura, this producer blends grapes from other regions to make this fresh, crisp and apple-flavored wine. It's light, bright and just off dry, with attractive acidity. Like it's rosé partner, it is really for apéritifs.
title: François Montand NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: The Grenache and Cinsault in this rosé are from the Jura and other vineyards. The result is a soft, smooth and creamy wine. Fresh red-berry fruits give it a round, almost off-dry character. It's fresh at the end, and definitely in an apéritif style.
title: François Montand NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Soft and creamy, this gentle sparkling wine has some ripe apple fruits and attractive acidity. A yeasty aftertaste is less attractive.
title: Marquis de la Tour NV Brut Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Whiffs of rising bread mingle with bright citrus notes on this full- bodied blanc de noir. Hints of sugar cookie and orange zest are balanced by bright acidity and a soft but exuberant petillance.
title: Trump 2008 Brut Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Monticello)

description: This clean, simple and tasty sparkling wine is a Chardonnay/Pinot Noir cuvée, done in the traditional methode Champenoise. Pale straw in color, it brings flavors of green apple and pink grapefruit, with a clean finish.
title: Wetzel Estate 2011 Rosé Sparkling (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a cheerful and easygoing rosé sparkling wine that offers measured aromas of wild berry and chalky white mineral. The wine is creamy and smooth in the mouth and ends with a playful sweet-against sour-note. Made with Corvina and other grapes found near Verona.
title: Monte del Frá NV Extra Dry Rosé Sparkling (Veneto)

description: Large bubbles and sharp flavors of peach, wild berry and white almond characterize the nose of this well-focused rosé sparkler made from Prosecco and Raboso grapes. The wine is tart and focused on the palate with lingering citrus notes.
title: Pizzolato NV Violette Brut Rosé Sparkling (Veneto)

description: A beautiful sparkling wine, rich and refined in the mouth, with creamy flavors that show ripe, sweet California strawberries and limes. This bottling gets better and better with each new release.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2004 Royal Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Briny, powdery white-fruit aromas are offset by vanilla cookie notes and a hint of bath soap. This feels foamy and chunky, while lemon-lime and melon flavors finish bland but inoffensive.
title: Destello NV Sparkling (Cava)

description: Aromas of pickled lime and not much else define the nose on this medium-bodied brut. Flavors of lettuce and lime are dry, while this remains dry and fresh on a clean, simple finish.
title: Aranleón NV Deshora Brut Orgánico Sparkling (Cava)

description: Colorful and pretty to look at, but a little sweet. The nose has a sweet, maple syrup element along with dry berry fruit aromas. It's healthy and fresh in the mouth, with citrus, cranberry and raspberry flavors. Simple and nice for easy drinking.
title: Codorníu NV Anna de Codorniu Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: Rusty orange in color, aromas of grass and tomato suggest underripe fruit, while the mouthfeel is foamy and the flavors of fruit and mushroom are muted.
title: Mont Marçal 2010 Trepat Rosado Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: An extremely lively mousse gives this wine an instant festive character. It also brightens the already fresh, crisp red berry fruits and acidity. It's totally ready to drink.
title: Pierre Sparr NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Apple, mineral and mild briny aromas are complex and interesting. Firm in body, with cutting acidity, this brut nature is bone dry, with white stone-fruit flavors that lean towards neutral except for a hint of salt. Minerality and cleansing acidity push an air-tight finish.
designation: Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature
title: Alta Alella 2012 Privat Laietà Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Brisk lemon freshness sets the tone on the nose. The very frothy mousse on the palate continues in this fruity, exuberant and fresh vein. The finish is superclean, brisk and dry, creating an ideal and invigorating apéritif-style for summer days.
title: André Kientzler 2013 Cuvée MIllésimée Non Dosée Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A whiff of elderflower and nettle appears on the nose before creamier hints of autolysis and green apple come in. The nettle makes another brief, aromatic appearance while the palate comes together to balance bright, green-apple crispness with mellow, subtly rich yeastiness. The bubbles are fine and soft, the finish is brisk and enlivening. It's a wonderfully harmonious, fresh apéritif style.
title: Bolney Wine Estate NV Bolney Bubbly Brut Sparkling (England)

description: A lovely blend of tart berry and red-apple notes creates an inviting nose. The palate brings these lovely, almost autumnal berry notes even further as they are amplified by the lively frothy mousse. This is totally fruit driven, very appetizing and refreshing with an almost cleansing but lasting finish.
title: Domaine Specht 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The enticing tartness of red and green apples dominates the appetizing nose. These crisp notes are heightened by a very lively frothing mousse on a light dry palate that shows both autolysis and freshness. The finish is lip-smacking and very refreshing and has a lasting hint of yeast.
title: Domaine Specht NV Blanc Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The vivid, deeply pink shade of this sparkler promises freshness. Both the nose and palate are chock-full of fruit: Tart red apple, strawberry and a touch of peach fill the head. The mousse is lively and frothy, the finish is dry, fresh and very moreish.
title: Gustave Lorentz NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Appetizing notes of strawberry and Red Delicious apple create an inviting opening. These same flavors play on the very frothy, totally fruit-driven but dry palate. This is fresh and refreshing and with its fruit-forward style, it's an ideal pale-pink drink for summer parties.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The red-fruit flavors on the nose almost have a candied edge, akin to red-berry candy. The palate adds lots of freshness and a finely fizzing mousse on its light fruit-driven body. The finish is refreshing, dry and echoes with fruit.
title: Lucien Albrecht NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Waxy white-fruit aromas are a touch austere and harsh. This holds a tight, crisp palate with flavors of yeast, apple and citrus fruits. A short, clean finish ensures that this closes with ease and clarity.
title: Perelada 2013 Gran Claustro Reserva But Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Mineral, lime and crisp apple aromas give it a precise, pure nose. And that same character exists on the palate and finish, where white peach, green banana and melon flavors are full and forward. Shows good concentration and quality for a large-production bubbly at this price.
title: Segura Viudas NV Aria Estate Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Dusty lemon and cidery aromas are solid and draw you in. The palate has a fresh, clean feel and lively, tangy flavors of citrus, green fruits and green herbs. Zesty, a bit lemony, and nice on the finish. Not a complicated bubbly by any means.
title: Sonim NV Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: The wine opens with a pretty pink color and offers simple aromas of cranberry and raspberry. Would pair with salty appetizers and fried finger foods.
title: Bonotto delle Tezze NV Raboso Rosato Frizzante Rosé Sparkling (Veneto)

description: With a deep, shiny color of copper and peach blush, you can tell this sparkling wine will be somewhat full-bodied and rich. And it is. Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, it's a big, flamboyant bubbly, rich in raspberries, limes and yeast. Yet it retains the delicacy and elegance of a fine sparkling wine.
title: Chandon NV Étoile Rosé Sparkling (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Notable for the smoothness and finesse of the mousse, or bubbles, this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay brut-style blend is rich and crisp in acidity. There's a honeyed sweetness to the generous strawberry, raspberry, lime and vanilla flavors.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Made from a majority of Pinot Noir grapes from several estate vineyards, as well as Chardonnay and a smidgen of Pinot Meunier, this sparkling rosé offers flavors of creamy strawberry and raspberry, the fruit ripe and succulent. A medium-size body and level of acidity keeps it steady on the palate, finishing with a flash of citrus.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A full-bodied expression of vanilla and stone fruit, with an almond base, this is made from half Chardonnay and just about half Pinot Noir, with a tiny addition of Pinot Meunier. Juicy and fresh, it'll pair well with heavier foods like crab or suffice as an apéritif, but could shine most brightly with dessert, in step on the palate with a crème brûlée.
title: J Vineyards & Winery NV XB Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Hints of creamy yogurt meld into bright tropical swirls of mango, melon and tangerine in this fun, fizzy sparkling blend. It's delicately effervescent with bristling lemonade acidity.
title: Henkell NV Brut Sparkling (Germany)

description: Briny apple aromas are crisp and focused, with side notes of pickle juice and matchstick. A round but firm palate is in fine shape, while this tastes savory, dry and sophisticated, with notes of sea brine, melon and green apple. A touch of salt graces a pure finish. This certified organic bottling dwells at the high end of the Cava spectrum.
designation: Privat Mirgin Brut Nature Gran Reserva
title: Alta Alella 2011 Privat Mirgin Brut Nature Gran Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: With a rusty salmon color, this Pinot Noir Cava offers citrus and red-fruit aromas along with earthy funk. The palate is generally well balanced, while smoky, earthy flavors of red fruits and citrus finish mild.
title: Segura Viudas NV Aria Pinot Noir Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Subtle aromas and flavors of crisp apple and cherry, a dry composition, fine texture and crisp finish make this rather reserved and well balanced. This reliable standby is the kind of bubbly to have on hand for spur-of-the-moment occasions.
title: Korbel NV Brut Sparkling (California)

description: Attractive and generously fruity, this offers flavors of apples and peaches and a mouthfilling mousse of bubbles. The texture is slightly soft but appetizing.
title: McFadden NV Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Potter Valley)

description: The scouring mouthfeel of this wine is its biggest issue. Although it's dryish and creamy, with pleasant flavors of dough, lime, orange and vanilla, its roughness limits its score.
title: Biltmore Estate NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: White flower and pink bubblegum notes lend a slightly confected tone to this semisweet Hungarian sparkling wine, but it's an undeniably drinkable, peach-flavored sip, with sharp effervescence and a tasty sugar-cookie finish.
title: Törley NV Fortuna Doux Sparkling (Hungary)

description: This vintage was a good one for Iron Horse, resulting in this wine of finesse and clarity. It's fruit-forward, with excellent acidity and a sour, yeasty bite help to balance its rich quality. The mousse is exceptionally refined. This has the potential to age quite well over the next decade.
title: Iron Horse 2005 Chinese Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: This blend is a classic brut, of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Each variety plays its best hand, with Pinot Noir bringing rich, ripe raspberries, strawberries and tannins. The Chardonnay brings acidity and tantalizing notes of limes. With a silky, refined mousse, this bubbly is extremely attractive.
title: Iron Horse 2009 Wedding Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: An enormously  complex wine, but one that's not quite ready for prime time. Mainly Chardonnay, with 21% Pinot Noir, this was aged on its lees for seven years, giving it a soft creaminess and also an intense, doughy yeastiness. The raspberry, lime, toast and vanilla flavors are rich and slightly honeyed. With brisk acidity and slight scouriness, it wants a good eight years in the cellar, and should age well beyond that.
title: Schramsberg 2005 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (Napa-Mendocino-Sonoma-Marin)

description: Yeasty applesauce aromas precede a full palate that weighs on the heavy and flat side. Obtuse flavors of apple finish solid and chunky but low on acidity and crispness. Overall this is good but slightly lazy on the palate.
title: Mont-Ferrant NV Americano Sparkling (Cava)

description: This one smells like a French Prosecco, with effusive bubbles and a citrusy bouquet. Off-dry, with lots of orange flavors. It finishes with a lively, lengthy, orange-rind explosion. This is very well made, and invites a second or third glass. It rests gently on the palate, and lingers pleasantly.
region_1: Clairette de Die Méthode Dioise Ancestrale
title: Carod Freres NV  Clairette de Die Méthode Dioise Ancestrale

description: It makes sense to produce this red sparkling wine in a medium-dry form. That's because the inevitable tannins are modified and are there to give shape to the strawberry fruits and fresh acidity. It's perhaps an acquired taste but would be fine with fruit desserts.
title: Bouvet-Ladubay NV Rubis Excellence Demi-Sec Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: With its fragrance of wild flowers and red berries, this wine is as attractive as its unique, square-based bottle that allows for more contact between the yeasts and wine during secondary fermentation. Made with Pinot Noir, the crisp, savory palate boasts crushed raspberries, mineral and baking spices alongside a silky mousse. Extremely elegant.
title: Ferghettina 2010 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Bracing and bright, this shows definite Chardonnay characteristics, such as a buttery, apple pie aroma and vivid crisp apple and lemon flavors. Nothing is overblown, though, so it retains finesse. This will be great as an apéritif and even better with seafood after sitting down at the table.
title: Schramsberg 2011 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (North Coast)

description: An everyday sparkler with a nice toasted nuttiness mingling with solid and persistent baked green apple and citrus pith flavors. The mouth is creamy with fine carbonation and medium acidity. Drink now.
title: Bourgeois Family NV Cuvée Stéphi Ebullience Sparkling (Crémant de Limoux)

description: Made with 70% Nebbiolo and 30% Pinot Nero, this savory sparker offers aromas and flavors of wild cherry, juicy strawberry, orange zest and a hint of cake spice. Fresh acidity and a vibrant but refined perlage provide the backdrop.
title: Rivetti Massimo 2009 Duemilanove Rosé Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

description: A creamy, frothy, baked-apple tone fills the palate very pleasantly. The dryness has a counterbalance in the apple fruit and the palate is harmonious and rounded. While this is refreshing, its aspect is geared far more towards being a winter apéritif than a summer refresher. The lasting finish signals that this is above average.
title: Domaine Charles Baur NV Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: The deep strawberry-pink color immediately spells fun but the palate is actually more serious than that. Full to the brim of strawberry fruit without being cloying or candied, there's a beautiful balance to the fruit expression, with lots of refreshment and plump, yet light-footed joy.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A good sparkling wine, a bit scoury around the edges, but nice and dry, with a fancy finish. Shows crisp flavors of yeasty lees, limes, lemons, vanilla and smoke.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Va de Vi Ultra Cuvée Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Red currant and fresh strawberry make for an enticing, inviting nose and carry on to the frothy, dry, slender palate. This is an easy, refreshing but wonderfully clean and fruity pink fizz.
title: Willm NV Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: A blend of 50% Nebbiolo, 30% Pinot Nero and 20% Chardonnay, this offers aromas of chamomile, lemon blossom, orchard fruit and lemon zest. The firm palate offers nectarine zest, ripe apple, toasted hazelnut and a note of bread crust alongside a vibrant perlage.
title: Rivetti Massimo 2010 Duemiladieci Bianco Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

description: Leesy apple aromas lead to a narrow, low-spritz palate. Briny, leesy flavors are salty and complex, not your typical apple-pear-and-fizz combination. A briny, low-fruit finish turns increasingly savory and like seashells the longer this sits. Drink now.
designation: Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature
title: Alta Alella 2010 Opus Evolutium Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Aromas of rose and baked apple lead the way on this vibrant sparkler. The lively palate delivers strawberry, nectarine zest and a note of bread crust alongside a firm, persistent pelage. An almond note closes the sharp finish.
title: Castello Bonomi NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This beautiful sparkler rested on its lees for 70 months, giving it extra smoothness and rich denseness. The bouquet is redolent of apricot, ripe fruit, melon and lightly toasted baguette. The mouthfeel is long, elegant and driven by fine perlage.
designation: Casa delle Colonne Zero Riserva Millesimato
title: Fratelli Berlucchi 2005 Casa delle Colonne Zero Riserva Millesimato Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This is the winery's highest quality wine, named in honor of their late winemaker, Guy Devaux, who brought a Champagne sensibility to the brand. At the age of eight years, it's softly complex and delicious in lime, raspberry, yeasty brioche and vanilla flavors. It has that hard to define quality of finesse that makes a fine sparkling wine so special.
title: Mumm Napa 2004 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: This feminine, delicate rosé sparkling wine from northern Italy opens with a beautiful peachy-pink color and lively aromas of stone fruit, cranberry, pink rose, dried grass and crushed mineral. Pair this wine with caviar or smoked salmon.
title: Bellavista 2005 Gran Cuvée Rosé Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Made predominantly from Pinot Nero and with no added dosage, this sparkling wine delivers aromas of acacia flower, toasted almond and honey that carry over to the palate. It has a fine perlage and a bone-dry finish.
title: Villa Crespia 2006 Francesco Iacono Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Soft and creamy, with pear and melon flavors dominating the bright acidity. It's an attractive wine, easy on the palate with a light touch of nuttiness to finish.
title: Dopff & Irion NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Yeasty, briney and strange on the nose, this feels clunky, with oily citrus and nut-driven flavors. It's bitter on the finish, and it doesn't show much in the way of mouthfeel. A blend of Chardonnay and Macabeo.
title: Dominio de la Vega NV Artemayor Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Basic apple aromas start it off, with a bit of lime coming in late. The palate is a touch boring and slightly heavy, with soft bubbles and thick, conventional apple flavors that turn sweet and mealy with time. Finishes with some baked corn and herbs.
title: Marqués de Gelida 2005 Brut Exclusive Reserva Sparkling (Cava)

description: Though excessively foamy, once it settles down this wine has a pretty pale copper shade, and a hint of strawberry and cherry in the fruit flavor. It's dry and delicate, with a clean, persistent finish.
title: Domaine Ste. Michelle NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A refreshing rosé sparkler that would pair with smoked salmon or fried calamari rings, this is tonic and bright, offering crisp acidity and tonic effervescence.
title: Lamberti NV Rosé Sparkling (Veneto)

description: A touch of pepper accentuates the fresh notion of wet stone and citrus on the nose. The palate is bone dry and has a fresh fizzing mousse that accentuates, stone, pepper and green citrus even more. The slightly austere, bone-dry style will come into its own with other pure restrained flavors—think subtle Japanese dishes. The finish is brisk and superclean.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Brut Nature Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Lemon plays on the nose alongside hints of shortbread. The palate has a lovely rich creaminess and very fine elegant mousse, creating an impression of light-bodied richness. This is sophisticated and dry, elegant and creamy—very grown-up and utterly delicious.
title: Vignoble des 2 Lunes 2013 Comète Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Dusty mineral notes mingle alongside pretty floral and apple aromas on this softly effervescent sparkling. A blend of 66% Pinot Noir and 34% Chardonnay, it's strikingly high in acidity but has pleasant lemon and apple flavors.
title: Atwater 2008 Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is a particularly fruity rosé that's not quite dry but very fresh and full of strawberry flavors. It is fresh, ripe and ready to drink even in the winter.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This sparkler was made from a majority of Chardonnay with a seasoning of Pinot Noir, the grapes grown at Hyde Vineyard, among other sites within the appellation. A doughy, tart wine, it brightly expresses green apple, orange, grapefruit and a more developed creaminess of biscotti, delighting in a persistence of lemon zest.
title: Schramsberg 2011 Methode Traditionelle Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Made from 56% Pinot Noir and 44% Chardonnay and given multiple extra years in bottle, this wine offers a substantial body weight within crisp well-defined acidity. Apple skin, bread dough and a note of hazelnut combine to afford warm welcoming flavor. Zero sugar is added.
title: Longboard NV Late Disgorged Brut Zero Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Something of both fresh and dried pink grapefruit zest plays about the nose. The very frothy palate adds some spice to that, as well as a pleasant hint of bitterness. All the fruit is accentuated by the frothing bursting bubbles. Drink soon, ideally as an animating apéritif. The zesty finish is very appetizing.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2014 Nature Extra Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with subtle aromas of yellow apple, citrus, lemon pastry and hazelnut that follow through to the palate. It's fresh, with bright acidity and a persistent, frothy perlage.
title: Gancia NV Cuvée 18 Mesi Metodo Classico Sparkling (Piemonte)

description: This opens with aromas of orchard fruit, citrus and toasted bread crust. The firm palate offers lime, vanilla, oak and yellow apple skin alongside bracing acidity. A note of bitter almond marks the finish.
title: Castello Bonomi 2010 Dosage Zero Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This méthode Champenoise blend of 76% Pinot Noir and 24% Chardonnay impresses with its inviting mousse of peach and strawberry. It's fresh and lush, aged on the lees for three years, giving it body without an overabundance of alcohol. Dry, it finishes with a twist of candied orange peel.
title: Frank Family 2012 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Formidable acidity gives this lovely wine a freshness around complementary layers of rose petal and strawberry-pomegranate. Made from a blend of two Chardonnay clones, it adds additional notes of tangerine and lemon-lime on the lengthy, complex finish.
designation: National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs
title: Iron Horse 2010 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Available in magnum only, this is an occasional bottling from the winery. A winery spokeperson told me my bottle was entirely 1993 vintage, but not all other bottles are. The wine is extraordinarily fine, but compared to other California bubblies, it's sandpapery and almost harsh at this point. As it warms up in the glass it shows an immense toasted nut and grilled fruit richness with an impossibly long finish. This is one to stash for the long haul.
title: Iron Horse NV Joy! Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Rich and smooth, this has complex flavors of raspberry, almond biscotti, lime and vanilla, with a smoky note. The texture shows real finesse. Made from Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it's a first class bubbly.
title: Chandon 2007 Vintage Brut Sparkling (Yountville)

description: More in the Champagne style, meaning the nose is yeasty and toasty, and the color is more gold than pale yellow. The palate offers wholesome apple, lemon and green herb flavors, and the finish is dry and peppery, with some bitterness. Strives for more complexity than most cavas, and it gets there for the most part.
title: Montsarra NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Vigorous bubbles present a Pinot Noir-like nose of crushed rocks, Indian spice and sour earth on one of the best Central Coast sparklers of the vintage. The intriguing flavors center on pluot and nectarine flesh, with fringes of salinity, lemon juice, cardamom and even dashes of curry.
title: Goat Bubbles 2011 Sierra Madre Vineyard Crémant Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made to commemorate the sparkling wine the winery produced for the Reagan-Gorbachev Summit Meetings in the 1980s, this blends 74% Pinot Noir and 26% Chardonnay in a richer style, still dry, and just recently disgorged in July 2014. Complex and creamy, it offers a seductive nose of ripe apple and custard, the flavors following through in a medium-weight, mellowed way.
title: Iron Horse 2009 Russian Cuvée Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Laetitia's finest reserve bottling of sparkling wine rises to the challenge in this vintage, with bright aromas of fresh pears, challah bread and cherimoya. The palate offers tropical touches of guava, with elements of soda and lime pith grounding the bubbly into a classic style.
title: Laetitia 2010 Cuvée M Sparkling (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Notes of mellow, ripe apple create an appetizing nose. Those rich but fresh apple notes continue throughout the palate, giving fullness of fruit and tart freshness at the same time. Fine, creamy mousse fizzes away, dispersing delicious apple notes across the palate. The body is light and the finish gloriously fresh and dry.
title: Loimer NV Extra Brut Sparkling (Niederösterreich)

description: Blossom honey, a touch of melon and fresh, fragrant red-apple fruit make for an appetizing nose. On the palate these alluring flavors are joined by the generous, rounded notion of sponge cake. Towards the finish the pure freshness of bright lemon takes over, and fine bubbles offer fruit and creaminess. It's a balanced and appetizing rosé with a lasting, beautifully yeasty finish.
title: Hush Heath Estate 2013 Balfour Brut Rosé Sparkling (England)

description: A good, dry and elegant bubbly. Shows crisp flavors of yeasty bread dough, limes, tangerines, raspberries and vanilla. This is a great price for a sparkling wine of this finesse.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: This rosé sparker opens with a pale pink color and pretty aromas of stone fruit, pink grapefruit and toasted bread. It feels soft and creamy with tightly spaced and elegant perlage.
title: Ronco Calino NV Brut Rosé Radijan Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: This wine has a pale orange color, apricot aromas, and jazzy peach and citrus flavors that are lively and fresh. It's nearly dry (1.5% dosage), and done in a sophisticated style, with fine-textured bubbles and a clean finish.
title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)

description: This is basically the same as Gloria's brut, only they added some Muscat and made it a little sweeter. With sugared raspberry, lime, orange and brioche flavors, made brisk with acidity, it will satisfy those who like some plumpness in their sparkling wines.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV Va de Vi Iltra Cuvée Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Nice and smooth, with refined bubbles that feel like silk gliding across the tongue. The orange, strawberry and vanilla flavors are slightly sweet.
title: Mumm Napa NV Brut Prestige Sparkling (Napa Valley)

description: Although the producer is based in the Loire, it sources grapes for this wine from other regions of France as well as locally. That gives the wine perhaps a richer, softer, less fresh character. It is an easy, apple-fruity wine with light acidity.
title: Monmousseau NV Brut Etoile Sparkling (Vin Mousseux)

description: Notions of tart red berries and lemon claim the nose. The palate is equally bouncy and fresh. This dances on tiptoe across the palate, teasing with its brisk freshness and flirting with its appetizing flavors. Underneath all that sits a more serious, stony core and a well of unending freshness. If you desire brisk berried brightness in your refreshments look no further.
title: Hattingley Valley Wines 2013 Rosé Sparkling (England)

description: Golden color and hints of oatmeal on the nose signal some evolution. The palate rewards this notion with rounded harmony: there is the merest touch of dark honey to the autolytic notes of wholemeal biscuit. Rounded lemony freshness stirs through everything and is dispersed with all of the tiny bubbles bursting. Lovely, resonant, very integrated and lasting.
title: Chapel Down 2010 Three Graces Sparkling (England)

description: This is a little wayward and funky on the nose, with a lightly pickled aroma. It's a forward Cava with a yeasty, creamy feel. Its acidity and proper bubbles set up flavors of pastry, powdered sugar and sweet apple. The finish is quick, ending with a white-pepper flavor.
title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2009 Aliguer Brut Vintage Sparkling (Cava)

description: Winemaker Oded Shakked works with 57% Pinot Noir and 43% Chardonnay from multiple vintages, using pure cane sugar in a small dosage. Full-bodied richness underlies a crispness of tight acidity and fresh-squeezed lime and apple, finishing dry and vibrantly refreshing.
title: Longboard NV Brut Cuvée Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: A majority of Pinot Noir is balanced by 40% Chardonnay. Nutty, rich and full figured, with a tenacity of stone fruit woven into the lengthy finish, this wine has moderate acidity, opting for a balance of concentration and weight.
title: Mumm Cuvée Napa NV Brut Reserve Sparkling (Napa County)

description: Elegant and creamy, with pretty highlights of peach, melon and toasted bread, this beautiful Italian sparkler makes a perfect opener for a long and sophisticated meal. Foamy effervescence gives the wine depth and persistency.
title: Ronco Calino NV Brut Satèn Sparkling (Franciacorta)

description: Toasted nut, smoke and slate aromas lend complexity and nuance to this high-pitched Riesling Sekt. Lemon-lime acidity and vivacious effervescence give the palate an electric feel, countered nicely by delicate swirls of sweet red apple and caramel. It's concentrated and boldly penetrating through a long finish.
title: Robert Weil 2014 Riesling Sekt Brut Sparkling (Rheingau)

description: Creamy, almost powdery pear flavors dominate, but the palate is illuminated by bright, sprightly lemon acidity. There is an innate balance that can be summed up as creamy lemon on a dry, yeasty background. This is moreish, appetizing and has a lasting, fruity finish.
title: Lucien Albrecht NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Delicate scents of white flowers and white orchard fruit lead the nose while the refreshing palate offers yellow apple, lime and lemon pastry. It's crisp and clean, with lively acidity and small vivacious bubbles.
title: Giribaldi 2012 Matteo Giribaldi Metodo Classico Sparkling (Vino Spumante)

description: Bright and cheery, this delicately sweet Marquette sparkling offers loads of fresh forward grapey flavor. It's a simple and straightforward wine but briskly composed.
title: Tug Hill 2014 Cuvée Rosé Sparkling (New York)

description: Blossomy in perfume, this Prosecco-inspired Finger Lakes sparkling offers fresh fruity citrus and red-apple flavors. It's softer and looser in petillance than wines made with Damiani's traditional method of bottling but striking acidity lends bold upright structure. Drink now.
title: Damiani 2015 Bollicini Sparkling (Finger Lakes)

description: Leesy aromas of tropical fruits feed into a flat palate. Leesy but bland peach and melon flavors lack conviction and finish sketchy, with nothing in particular standing out. This is the definition of a marginal Cava.
title: Mont Paral NV Reserva Selection Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Briny apple and nectarine aromas are within the proper framework of brut nature. Citric and stone-fruit acidity makes for a racy palate, while this tastes mostly of peach and nectarine along with some salt and brine. A firm finish is acidic and dry.
title: Vins El Cep 2011 Claror Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: Dry, pure and attractive on the nose, with crisp apple and lemon-lime flavors. This wine performs on an even keel from start to finish, and it's dry, tangy and correct as far as brut nature cavas go. Verges on elegant.
title: Sumarroca 2005 Brut Nature Gran Reserva Cava Sparkling (Penedès)

description: Pretty pear, apple and other dusty white-fruit aromas start this cleansing cava on its way to pure citrus, Granny Smith apple and lime flavors. It has a mildly linear, angular feel but it doesn't come across sheer or sour; to the contrary, it's balanced and generous with its fruit.
title: Mas de Monistrol NV MPX Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Light and crisp, this wine has a smooth apple flavor and soft acidity. It is fragrant and fruity, with some sweetness on the finish. It would make for a good apéritif.
title: Domaine du Vissoux NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A light color and tropical aromas of lime and lychee set up a full but flaccid palate. Yeasty bready flavors are less than fruity, while this tastes similar on a low-acid finish.
title: Salton NV Intenso Brut Sparkling (Serra Gaúcha)

description: Sometimes you want the richness of a rosé sparkler, and with this Pinot Noir and Chardonnay blend, you get plenty of flavor. Although its dry, it's flamboyant in raspberries, strawberries and vanilla, along with the stimulating yeast of a great bubbly. Just great on its own, or drink with sushi or roast salmon.
title: Domaine Carneros 2006 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)

description: Aromas of cherry and leather come with burnt earth and smoke, but overall the nose is inviting. The palate is solid in feel, with good weight and drive that supports a smoky flavor profile of red berries and controlled bitterness. Finishes toasty, with a lick of bitter chocolate.
title: Freixenet NV Elyssia Pinot Noir Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Good on the nose, with solid raspberry and nectarine aromas. The palate is spunky and alert, with juicy red-cherry, rhubarb and integrated spice flavors. It's mostly a clean, basic, easy-to-drink bubbly, but it's persistent, harmonious and commendable. Pinot Noir with Trepat is the grape mix.
title: Loxarel NV 999 Brut Rosat Sparkling (Cava)

description: This is your quintessential simple quaff among brut cavas. It's clean, lime-tinged and soda-like on the nose, with a correct, no-issues palate that pushes zesty apple along with sweet papaya, mango and banana flavors. It's slightly sweet and tropical, but still it holds onto its crisp qualities and dryness. No complaints for the money.
title: Freixenet NV Cordon Negro Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: After an early aromatic blast of sulfuric matchstick, this turns for the better while providing scents of citrus, fresh-cut grass and minerals. The palate is zesty, with briny flavors of nectarine and orange. A minerally, slightly salty finish keeps this on course.
title: Alta Alella 2013 Private Reserve Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: A fragrant cherry-blossom scent accentuates the fresh red-raspberry and strawberry notes on the nose and palate of this delicious, easy-drinking sparkling. Lush and ripe, the Cuvée Carnaval would be a lovely apéritif for late-summer entertaining.
title: Sparkling Pointe NV Cuvée Carnaval Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A haze of summer flowers hovers across a fizzy feast of crunchy, green apple. Autolytic notes of bread stay clearly in the background while this easy, joyful wine majors on primary, crisp apple fruit and a whistle-clean finish.
title: Ridgeview Estate 2013 Cavendish Sparkling (England)

description: A blend of Cabernet Franc and Pinot Noir, this pale pink rosé has really fresh acidity and crisp apple fruits. There are just hints of red-berry fruits and a touch of tannin that gives the wine an edge of dryness. The aftertaste, with the creamy mousse, is fresh and lively.
title: Monmousseau NV Rosé Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)

description: Very light in color, this bottling by the Coppola family shows sweeter aromas of Gravenstein apple, ripe pear, honeysuckle and tuberose on the nose. It's also a tad sweet on the palate, especially for today's sparkling standards, but will surely attract a wide fan base thanks to apple custard, cotton candy and plumeria-like flavors, all dissected by racy bubbles and acidity.
title: Sofia 2014 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Monterey County)

description: The best of a strong series of sparklers from this winery and vineyard on the western edge of the appellation, this Chardonnay-based bubbly shows light toast, chalk and lemon mousse on the pure and appealing nose. The effervescence is quite aggressive, with spectacular foaming on the sip that sizzles from front to back, carrying a soft texture but framed by racy acidity.
title: Presqu'ile 2012 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Yeasty floral aromas are a touch soapy and not all that exact. This Trepat-based Cava feels light, crisp and zesty, while flavors of tangerine and lime finish breezy and citric, with a distant hint of elegance.
title: Pere Ventura NV Tresor Rosé Sparkling (Cava)

description: The nose on this sparkler is dusty. The palate weighs in heavy, with pounding flavors of peach and melon. The finish is soda-like yet salty.
title: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay Sparkling (Mendoza)

description: This opens with grassy, oxidized aromas of papaya and hay. The mouth is foamy and crude, with herbal, stalky flavors of salty, briny melon and nectarine. Not that it matters much, but the blend is Chardonnay, Chenin Blanc and Pinot Noir.
title: Solsticio NV Equinox de Primavera Extra Brut Sparkling (Mendoza)
